abstract: News Corp investors are putting pressure on Murdoch family to disentangle themselves from leadership, as phone hacking scandal and inter-family conflict shake shareholder confidence; Murdochs hold 40 percent share in company, granting them effective control, but transfer of leadership from Rupert Murdoch to son James or Lachlan is in doubt nonetheless.
snippet: Rupert Murdoch reached his boiling point last winter, a former official said, and delivered a blunt ultimatum to his son James: “You’re coming back to New York, or you’re out.”

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch reached his boiling point last winter, a former official said, and delivered a blunt ultimatum to his son James: “You’re coming back to New York, or you’re out.”

headline.main: In Rift Between Murdochs, Heir Becomes Less Apparent
headline.print_headline: In Rift Between Murdochs, Heir Becomes Less Apparent
headline.seo: Murdochs’ Infighting Clouds Future of News Corp.
